<!-- Store an example for a texture asset -->

<!-- The GLGE component stores informatoin about the version of the loader that the file was saved with as well as an optional comment -->
<GLGE version="0.1.0">An example for a simple texture asset</GLGE>

<!-- store a texture asset. The name attribute is mandatory. -->
<texture name="cube texture">

    <!-- store some formating to apply to the data -->
    <format channels="3"></format>

    <!-- store the data for the texture asset. Example: file="assets/textures/cubeTexture.png" -->
    <data>
        <!-- the data can also be in-lined using base 64 encoding. This is not recomended for releases, since a lot more memory is used. But here it is used as an example. -->
        
    </data>

</texture>
